About

The Melodramatics Theatre Company

I got involved with the MTC right when I got to Cornell in the Fall of 2010 and it's the student organization I have been involved with throughout my entire Cornell career. Over the past seven semesters, I have worked on several classical musicals — Little Women: The Musical, Dirty Rotten Scoundrels, and The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee — and even a few rock shows — Spring Awakening, RENT, and bare: a pop opera. This fall, I'm very excited to conduct one of the best scores ever — Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street for the MTC's 10th anniversary.

Although I was hooked in through the conducting position, I've worked on several other aspects before. For the past several semester, I have served as the Business Manager, where I oversee the budgeting for each show, ticket sales, quarterly taxes, and other fiscal responsibilites to keep our 501(c)(3) status active. I've also updated the content on the website and worked on a redesign of it for my web programming class during the Spring of 2013.

I'm very excited to say that I was recently asked to join the Board of Trustees. This group consists of alumni of the organization that oversee the staffing process, assist in show selection, and provide guidance to the current General Manager of the company.
